intro: Canarium pimeloides, commonly known as the black oil palm, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, compound leaves and smooth, dark bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into drupes, which contain a single seed surrounded by a fleshy, oily pulp. It is valued for its oil-rich fruits, which are used in both culinary and industrial applications. The species also plays an important role in the ecosystems of its native habitats.
